Hartman, A. M., & Hollister, L. E. (1963). Effect of mescaline, lysergic acid diethylamide and psilocybin on color perception. Psychopharmacologia, 4(6), 449-451.
Kleinman, J. E., Gillin, J. C., & Wyatt, R. J. (1977). A comparison of the phenomenology of hallucinogens and schizophrenia from some autobiographical accounts. Schizophrenia Bulletin, 3(4), 562-567.
Gallimore, A. R. (2015). Restructuring consciousness–the psychedelic state in light of integrated information theory. Frontiers in human neuroscience, 9, 346.

Obreshkova, D., Kandilarov, I., Angelova, V. T., Iliev, Y., Atanasov, P., & Fotev, P. S. (2017). Pharmaco-toxicological aspects and analysis of phenylalkylamine and indolylalkylamine hallucinogens. Pharmacia, 64(1), 32-47. (2)
Papoutsis, I., Nikolaou, P., Stefanidou, M., Spiliopoulou, C., & Athanaselis, S. (2015). 25B-NBOMe and its precursor 2C-B: modern trends and hidden dangers. Forensic Toxicology, 33(1), 4.

Bersani, F. S., Corazza, O., Albano, G., Valeriani, G., Santacroce, R., Bolzan Mariotti Posocco, F., ... & Schifano, F. (2014). 25C-NBOMe: preliminary data on pharmacology, psychoactive effects, and toxicity of a new potent and dangerous hallucinogenic drug. BioMed Research International, 2014.
Abraham, H. D. (1983). Visual phenomenology of the LSD flashback. Arch Gen Psychiatry, 40(8), 886-887.

Baggott, M. J., Coyle, J. R., Erowid, E., Erowid, F., & Robertson, L. C. (2011). Abnormal visual experiences in individuals with histories of hallucinogen use: a Web-based questionnaire. Drug & Alcohol Dependence, 114(1), 63-64.
Dillon, P., Copeland, J., & Jansen, K. (2003). Patterns of use and harms associated with non-medical ketamine use. Drug & Alcohol Dependence, 69(1), 26.

[p][b]Colour enhancement[/b] is a perceived intensification of the brightness and vividness of colours in the external environment. During this experience, reds may seem “redder”, greens may seem “greener", and all colours will likely appear much more distinct, complex, and visually intense than they comparatively would during everyday sober living.[ref to="1" no="1" /][ref to="2" no="1" /][ref to="3" /][ref to="4" /][ref to="5" no="1" /][ref to="6" no="1" /][ref to="7" /][ref to="8" /] At higher levels, this effect can sometimes result in seeing colours that are perceived as surreal or seemingly impossible.[ref to="1" no="2" /][ref to="2" no="2" /][/p]

[p]Colour enhancement is often accompanied by other coinciding effects such as [int-link to="/effects/visual-acuity-enhancement"]visual acuity enhancement[/int-link] and [int-link to="/effects/increased-pareidolia"]increased pareidolia[/int-link].[ref to="5" no="2" /][ref to="6" no="2" /] It is most commonly induced under the influence of mild dosages of [int-link to="/summaries/psychedelics/visual"]psychedelic[/int-link] compounds, such as LSD, psilocybin, and mescaline. However, it can also occur to a lesser extent under the influence of certain stimulants and [int-link to="/summaries/dissociatives"]dissociatives[/int-link] such as MDMA, ketamine[ref to="9" /], or 3-MeO-PCP.[/p]

Colour enhancement is a perceived intensification of the brightness and vividness of colours in the external environment.  It is most commonly induced under the influence of mild dosages of psychedelic compounds, such as LSD, psilocybin, and mescaline.

During this experience, reds may seem “redder”, greens may seem “greener\", and all colours will likely appear much more distinct, complex, and visually intense than they comparatively would during everyday sober living. At higher levels, this effect can sometimes result in seeing colours that are perceived as surreal or seemingly impossible.[/p]\n\n[p]Colour enhancement is often accompanied by other coinciding effects such as [int-link to=\"/effects/visual-acuity-enhancement\"]visual acuity enhancement[/int-link] and [int-link to=\"/effects/increased-pareidolia\"]increased pareidolia[/int-link]. It is most commonly induced under the influence of mild dosages of [int-link to=\"/summaries/psychedelics/visual\"]psychedelic[/int-link] compounds, such as LSD, psilocybin, and mescaline. However, it can also occur to a lesser extent under the influence of certain stimulants and [int-link to=\"/summaries/dissociatives\"]dissociatives[/int-link] such as MDMA, ketamine, or 3-MeO-PCP.[/p]"}]

[p][b]Colour enhancement[/b] is a perceived intensification of the brightness and vividness of colours in the external environment. During this experience, reds may seem “redder”, greens may seem “greener", and all colours will likely appear much more distinct, complex, and visually intense than they comparatively would during everyday sober living. At higher levels, this effect can sometimes result in seeing colours that are perceived as surreal or seemingly impossible.[/p]

[p]Colour enhancement is often accompanied by other coinciding effects such as [int-link to="/effects/visual-acuity-enhancement"]visual acuity enhancement[/int-link] and [int-link to="/effects/increased-pareidolia"]increased pareidolia[/int-link]. It is most commonly induced under the influence of mild dosages of [int-link to="/summaries/psychedelics/visual"]psychedelic[/int-link] compounds, such as LSD, psilocybin, and mescaline. However, it can also occur to a lesser extent under the influence of certain stimulants and [int-link to="/summaries/dissociatives"]dissociatives[/int-link] such as MDMA, ketamine, or 3-MeO-PCP.[/p]
An apartment in Seattle with a close internet friend who I'd just met for the first time.
I Am a Big Gushing Fool
A cabin deep within the mountain forests of eastern Washington, with two other friends who were also tripping.
A small dark room in the company of my friend
Around the park/woods, my friend's house
I designed it this way myself
At home while talking to my girlfriend via skype
At home with my flatmate who took a similar dosage.
My skin didn't look like this before
Tripping with my friend in our apartment
At home alone in my apartment
At first at home, later in a city park
The length of broad street and my apartment
At home with my friend who is also tripping
Nexuswalk - A beautiful mix of DXM and 2C-B
Guanfacine 3mg, Buspar 30mg x2, Quiviviq 25mg, Folic Acid, Multi Vitamin.
You do not need to understand
Cliff top of seaside town, backing on to a national park

At home and also out in nature.
